children: Brazil has a vibrant and massive fashion scene on Instagram. To tap into this audience, a smart hashtag strategy is non-negotiable. Simply using generic English hashtags won't cut it. Here’s how to build a strategy that works for the Brazilian market.
The most effective strategy involves using a mix of different types of hashtags. Aim for around 20-25 hashtags per post, broken down into these categories:

items: Broad & Popular (3-5): These are high-traffic hashtags in Portuguese. Examples: `#moda`, `#lookdodia`, `#estilo`, `#fashion`. They give you a quick burst of visibility.

Niche-Specific (5-10): These relate to your specific style or the item you're showcasing. Examples: `#modapraia` (beach fashion), `#lookdeinverno` (winter look), `#alfaiataria` (tailoring), `#modasustentavel` (sustainable fashion).
Location-Based (2-3): Target users in specific cities or states. Examples: `#modasp` (São Paulo fashion), `#riodejaneiro`, `#fashionrio`.
Branded (1-2): Create a unique hashtag for your brand or personal profile. Example: `#EstiloDaMaria`.
Community (3-5): Engage with larger fashion communities. Examples: `#fashionblogger`, `#blogueirademoda`, `#dicasdemoda`.

children: You have two main options: in the caption itself or in the first comment. Both work equally well for reach. Placing them in the first comment can make your caption look cleaner. Experiment to see what you prefer.

Don't use the same block of 25 hashtags on every single post. Instagram's algorithm can view this as spammy behavior. Create several different sets of hashtags for different types of content (e.g., one set for casual looks, one for event looks).

Use the Instagram search bar to see how popular a hashtag is. Tools like TurboTags are invaluable here, as they can generate diverse, relevant lists of hashtags specifically for the Brazilian region, saving you hours of manual research.
